column4: Hello, I have a problem with Nvidia drivers after upgrading to hoary, X just wont start when I have "nvidia" in my xorg.conf, error says that my Nvidia kernel module is 1.0.6111 and my X module is 1.0.6629, thus API mismatch. How can I fix this?
can anyone help me with Nvidia stuff please?
boot to hoary kernel
but then, there's another error with hoary kernel
ah... of course you could just go grab the driver from nv website
really? I thought it alredy gor updated from the repository...
yes, you got the new driver but the kernel driver was for the heary kernel, not the old warty one
so now, I have to boot with 2.6.10 and get nvidia drivers from their site?
if you boot w/ 2.6.10 it should work directly
if you want to stick w/ tho old kernel remove nvidia packages and install the driver from nv website
it does not work there either :( anyway, will try the second advice
yes, it is optimal. but get a big drive, you can always use the disk space. small drive will only piss you off in the long run
sorry wrong msg
when you mean remove nvidia stuff, do you mean nvidia-kernel-common or nvidia-glx ?
all of it
but trying to remove nvidia-kernel-common tries to remove some kernel stuff
what stuff?
linux-386, linux-restricted-modules-2.6-386, linux-restricted-modules-2.6.10-2-386, linux-restricted-modules-2.6.8.1-3-386 and linux-restricted-modules-386
well, I guess they could go
so now I have to boot with 2.6.10 and install download drivers right?
yes
be sure to have kernel headers installed
